triples.name: Agent-based model
triples.relevance: The paper provides validation methods specifically for agent-based modeling and simulation systems.

triples.name: Verification and validation of computer simulation models
triples.relevance: Validation is the core topic of the paper, determining if a model adequately represents the system under study.

triples.name: Empirical evidence
triples.relevance: Empirical validation is one of the nine foundational validation methods reviewed in the paper.

triples.name: Sampling (statistics)
triples.relevance: Sampling is identified as a foundational validation method for testing agent-based models.

triples.name: Data visualization
triples.relevance: Visualization is reviewed as a foundational method for validating and understanding simulation model behavior.

triples.name: Bootstrapping (statistics)
triples.relevance: Bootstrapping is presented as an advanced validation method for assessing uncertainty in agent-based model outputs.

triples.name: Causal analysis
triples.relevance: Causal analysis is reviewed as an advanced method for validating the causal mechanisms within agent-based models.
